page.title: 16Farming in Wytham
page.content: The University Field Station, as a farm, is worked for profit.As an area of research, the 620 acres of land are an outdoor laboratory. Animal and plant behaviour is stydied. 50% of the land is under grass, 50% sown with winter and spring barley and winter wheat. The herd of 105 Freisian cows is kept for milk; 276 bulls, heifers and steers are for beef or breeding. A flock of 800 sheep, cross Swaledale and Leicester ewes and lambs, with Suffolk are bred for meat. Over 300 Landrace/Large White pigs are bred for bacon.The soil, which varies from light gravels to heavy clay, is kept workable by much machinery.Eight people work here besides the farm manager, who, looking around him, thinks this will be a good year.
